section.title: ~/About
section.description: Brief information about me and some of my interests.

bio: I am a recent graduate from UMass Amherst with a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science. I am currently working full-time at Raytheon as a Software Test Engineer on the SPY-6 program. Prior to this role, I completed an internship at CommScope during my junior year, where I automated fiber node test frameworks and developed new features.
I have a profound interest in various types of software development and full-stack development. In my free time, I enjoy playing tennis and trying new food.

section.title: ~/Experience
section.description: My current/past relevant experience. Click [here](/resume) to view my resume.

experience_items.title: Analyst
description: Developed data analysis tools, scripts and devised flight scenarios to verify SPY6 (AMDR and EASR) radar A-spec requirements.
Analyze live flight test and simulation data for SPY-6 (AMDR and EASR) to verify that radar meets criteria for successful high stake tests
Led VI meetings with stakeholders to finalize and secure alignment on critical requirements.
Collaborated closely with mentors to refine development skills and deepen understanding of radar system design principles.

experience_items.title: Software Intern
description: Automated testing on ServAssure NXT Alarm Central, enhancing identification and prioritization of service impairments in cable network elements, resulting in a 30% efficiency boost in issue detection and resolution
Integrated custom API scripts, optimized website to fulfill unique client requirements and enhance user experience.

Created test framework to validate Alarm Central data against On-Demand data across multiple fiber-nodes, significantly reducing testing time and promptly identifying cable network discrepancies and sending alerts in real time
